Description: Round bodied vase of Nile silt pottery with a small flat base, short neck and out-turned roll rim, coated with red slip and well burnished.
Curator's comments: Possibly illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xiii.75b; Polished Red ware P75B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921), but this is not accurate. More like P38F. Marked B262 in ink on side.
